item.title: Google Chrome starts rolling out Material You redesign; here is everything new
item.description: Google Chrome recently celebrated its 15th anniversary and announced plans for a refreshed design. The upcoming changes will include the incorporation of the material you theme, featuring more rounded corners, updated icons, and the removal of the lock icon from the address bar. This marks the first major transformation for Chrome in five years. The redesign aims to enhance legibility, introduce new color palettes, and better integrate with operating systems. Despite these changes, the overall layout and appearance of the browser will remain familiar. Notably, there will be a new drop-down menu to display open tabs and recently closed ones, and horizontal tabs at the top will appear as small pills when hovered over. The absence of the lock icon is justified by the widespread adoption of HTTPS, and it is replaced by a settings icon for connection security and other options. Additionally, there are new outlined style icons and a range of bright material you color palettes. Quick access to bookmarks, reading lists, and history is facilitated through the side panel icon. Overall, the redesign aims to provide a fresh look and improved features for Google Chrome users.

item.title: iOS 17.2 Beta 2: Apple takes steps to retire iTunes Movie Store, suggests report
item.description: Apple has released the iOS 17.2 public beta 2, which includes new features such as spatial video recording and a journal app for iPhones. However, a less-talked-about change suggests that Apple is taking steps to retire the dedicated iTunes movie store. Code strings indicate that iPhone users will eventually receive a notification stating that iTunes movies are moving to the Apple TV app. The TV app has been updated with a new sidebar for easier navigation, and speculation suggests that additional changes will make the iTunes movie store obsolete. The movies and TV shows tabs will be removed from the iTunes store, but users can still access them until the global release of iOS 17.2. Additionally, the update introduces spatial video recording exclusively for the iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max and extends the sensitive contact warning feature to include contact posters in certain apps.

item.title: Garena Free Fire Max redeem codes for Nov 11, 2023: Grab exciting rewards
item.description:
Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The article discusses the use of redeem codes in Garena Free Fire Max, a popular online game. These codes can be used to obtain various in-game items such as weapons, diamonds, and skins. The codes are 12 digit alphanumeric combinations that consist of capital letters and numbers.
Garena Free Fire Max is a revamped version of Garena Free Fire, which gained popularity after the ban of the latter by the Indian government. The game developers update these codes regularly, and players can visit a dedicated microsite to redeem them.
By redeeming the codes, players have a chance to win rewards like Rebel Academy Weapon Loot Crate, Revolt Weapon Loot Crate, Diamonds Voucher, and Fire Head Hunting Parachute. It's important to note that these codes are available for a limited time (up to 12 hours) and only for the first 500 users. Therefore, it's advised to redeem the codes promptly before they are exhausted.
The article also provides instructions on how to redeem the codes. Players need to visit the game's official Rewards Redemption site on Chrome, log in using their social media accounts, copy the mentioned codes, paste them in the text box, and click on Confirm. The rewards will be received in the in-game mail section, with golds or diamonds added automatically to the account wallet. Players can then access the game vault to exchange the codes for gold and diamonds, which can be used to purchase various in-game items.
In conclusion, Garena Free Fire Max redeem codes offer players a chance to obtain valuable in-game rewards. Following the given instructions, players can easily redeem the codes and enjoy the benefits they provide.

item.description: Vijay Sales is offering up to 60% off on a wide range of electronics for the upcoming festival of Diwali. The sale includes deals on smartphones, tech gadgets, smart TVs, laptops, and more. Customers using specific credit or debit cards from HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, HSBC, and other banks can receive instant discounts of up to ₹7,500. Some notable deals include the Sansui 32-inch HD ready smart Google TV for ₹11,499, the Redmi Note 12 5G smartphone with 128GB storage for ₹15,499, and the Boat Airdopes 148 true wireless earbuds for ₹999. Additionally, there are discounts on washing machines, geysers, microwaves, and other appliances. For HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank cardholders, there are further discounts available on transactions above specific amounts.

item.title: Google announces mass removal of inactive Gmail accounts: All you need to know
item.description: Google plans to delete inactive Gmail accounts as part of a policy shift. If a Gmail account remains unused for more than two years, it may be deleted along with its associated content within Google Workspace. This change in policy aims to address potential security breaches and leaks, as inactive accounts are less likely to have two-factor authentication configured. Google advises users to log in at least once every two years to prevent their accounts from becoming inactive. In other news, Google is expanding its car crash detection feature on Pixel phones to include India and four other countries.

item.title: Amazon Great Indian Festival Sale ends tonight: Affordable smartphones under ₹10,000 you shouldn't miss
item.description:
You are a detective investigating a murder case. The victim is John Doe, a wealthy businessman who was found dead in his mansion. The police have gathered some evidence, and you need to analyze it to figure out what happened. Here is the evidence:
1. Autopsy report: John Doe died from a single gunshot wound to the chest. The bullet trajectory indicates that the shooter was standing in front of him.
2. Security camera footage: The footage shows an unidentified person entering the mansion around the estimated time of death. The person's face is not visible as they are wearing a hoodie and a mask.
3. Fingerprints: Several fingerprints were found on a glass near John Doe's body. The forensic team confirmed that they belong to an employee named Lisa Adams. She worked as John Doe's personal assistant.
4. Witness statement: One of John Doe's neighbors reported hearing a loud argument coming from the mansion shortly before the estimated time of death. They couldn't identify the voices but mentioned that it sounded intense.
Based on the evidence provided, what would you like to know or do next?

item.title: ChatGPT CEO Sam Altman takes a jibe at Elon Musk’s AI chatbot Grok; netizens react with memes, jokes
item.description: Sam Altman, CEO of ChatGPT, mocked Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, in a lighthearted tweet. The tweet featured a screenshot of Grok's user interface, promising humor reminiscent of an old-fashioned style. Altman's caption alluded to the growing reliance on AI for various tasks. Grok is designed to answer questions with wit and has a rebellious streak. Altman's witty remark showcases the playful rivalry and camaraderie within the tech sector. Netizens reacted enthusiastically to Altman's tweet, sharing their own jokes and memes about the AI bots.

item.title: Apple Watch's timely alert leads to life-saving diagnosis, earns praise from grateful user and CEO Tim Cook
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.An Oklahoma woman credits her Apple Watch for saving her life by alerting her to an irregular heart rhythm called atrial fibrillation. Initially considering delaying a doctor's visit, she was persuaded by the watch notification and the encouragement of those around her to seek medical attention. The visit to the doctor led to a surprising diagnosis of diabetes and elevated blood sugar levels, indicating that the Apple Watch's initial alert played a crucial role in identifying these conditions. The woman's daughter also expressed gratitude for the life-saving diagnosis and contacted Apple CEO Tim Cook, who responded on the same day and expressed his happiness that Apple's technology had safeguarded her life. The Apple Watch has become an essential part of the woman's daily routine and is credited with saving her life.

item.title: Samsung dives into Mixed Reality headset league with ‘Infinite,’ an Apple Vision Pro competitor: Report
item.description: Samsung is reportedly developing a mixed-reality headset, similar to Apple's Vision Pro. There have been ongoing discussions and speculation about the project, with some intriguing information available. The release of Apple's Vision Pro has supposedly led to the postponement of Samsung's XR headset launch, which was originally planned for this year. The rumored launch date for the Samsung headset is late 2024, and it may be codenamed "Infinite." Samsung is said to be collaborating with Google and Qualcomm on this project, and there are rumors that the headset could operate on an Android version and be powered by a Snapdragon chipset. It is speculated that Samsung may use Samsung Display's OLEDs for the display of the headset. However, all information surrounding the Samsung mixed reality headset is based on rumors and speculation, and official details have yet to be released. In other news, Samsung recently launched its generative AI model called Samsung Gauss at the company's AI forum 2023.

item.title: Ducati's limited-production Panigale V4 SP2 celebrates 30 years of 916 legacy: All you need to know
item.description: Ducati has announced the Panigale V4 SP2 30th Anniversary 916, a limited edition motorcycle paying tribute to the 30th anniversary of the 916 model. The bike will debut at EICMA 2023 and will be showcased at the Ducati World Premiere. Only 500 units will be produced. The Panigale V4 SP2 30th Anniversary 916 features distinct design elements such as air intakes, a diamond-shaped fuel tank, and a single-sided swingarm. The bike's livery is a homage to the racing graphics of the 916 that won the Superbike World Championship in 1999. The fairing, number plates, and logo have been updated while maintaining the classic tri-color scheme. The special edition includes a billet aluminum steering plate with engraved model name and numbering, a certificate of authenticity, and a specially designed bike cover. It is equipped with various high-performance features such as carbon fiber components, Brembo brakes, adjustable footpegs, and a data acquisition system.

item.title: WhatsApp rolls out Protect IP address in calls feature: Here's how to enable it
item.description: WhatsApp has introduced a new privacy feature called 'protect IP address in calls' to address the concern of users having to disclose their IP addresses to each other during calls. This feature routes individual calls through WhatsApp's servers, concealing the IP addresses from other participants. The platform confirms that all calls are still end-to-end encrypted. The feature is being gradually rolled out for Android and iOS users. In addition, WhatsApp is reportedly developing voice message and sticker features, and there is a possibility of ads appearing in different locations, like status or channels.

item.title: Apple's iMessage should be a 'core' service, Google tells EU. Here's what it means
item.description: Google, Vodafone, Deutsche Telekom, Telefónica, and Orange have written a letter to the European Commission urging them to regulate Apple's iMessage as a 'core' platform service under the new Digital Markets Act (DMA). They argue that designating iMessage as a 'core' service would benefit consumers by allowing enriched messaging features to be available across different platforms. The companies also highlight that currently, only Apple users can send enriched messages through iMessage, while others must rely on traditional SMS. Apple has responded by claiming that iMessage should not fall under the new rules because users do not directly pay for the service and Apple devices can be used without it. However, the Commission notes that iMessage indirectly contributes to increasing Apple's revenue and plays an important role in expanding its ecosystem. If iMessage is designated as a 'core' platform service, Apple will be required to make it interoperable with other similar messaging apps.

item.title: Apple Festive Season offers: Get 50% discount on Airpods 3rd gen with iPhone 14 and more
item.description: Apple has launched new Diwali offers in India, providing customers with discounts on AirPods when purchasing an iPhone. The company will sell its products directly from its stores in Delhi and Mumbai for the first time. Customers can enjoy a discount of up to 50% on the third-generation AirPods when buying the iPhone 14 or iPhone 14 Plus. The base models of the iPhone 14 are priced at Rs. 69,900 and the iPhone 14 Pro starts at Rs. 79,900. Customers also have the option to upgrade to AirPods with a MagSafe charging case or AirPods Pro by paying the price difference. Apple is also offering a complimentary six-month subscription to Apple Music with the purchase of these smartphones. Instant savings and no-cost EMI offers are available for eligible cardholders. Additionally, customers can choose to have their new purchases engraved with a combination of emojis, numbers, and text in various languages.

item.title: GTA 6 expected to launch this week; trailer might drop in December: Report
item.description: Rockstar Games, a subsidiary of Take-Two Interactive Software Inc., is preparing to announce the highly anticipated next installment of the Grand Theft Auto series, according to sources familiar with the matter. The company reportedly plans to release a trailer for Grand Theft Auto VI next month to commemorate Rockstar's 25th anniversary. With its predecessor selling over 185 million copies, making it the second best-selling video game of all time, Grand Theft Auto VI has generated immense excitement among fans and investors. The game is set in a fictional version of Miami and features two main characters, one male and one female. Leaked gameplay videos have suggested that players might be able to earn money through white-collar crime, including money laundering through purchasable properties and businesses.

item.title: GTA VI likely to be announced this week. Launch date, new characters and everything we know so far
item.description: Rockstar Games is reportedly set to announce the highly anticipated sequel to the Grand Theft Auto series, GTA VI, this week. The game's trailer may be released the following month as part of Rockstar Games' 25th anniversary celebrations. Grand Theft Auto V, the previous installment, is the second best-selling game of all time, with 185 million copies sold. Last year, hackers leaked early gameplay footage of GTA VI, which Rockstar attributed to a "network intrusion." To prevent burnout among employees, Rockstar has been working on improving work-life balance and addressing corporate culture issues. While details about GTA VI have been scarce, it is rumored to be set in a fictional version of Miami and will include both male and female protagonists. The developers are also said to be mindful of avoiding jokes that marginalize communities. Leaks suggest that the game could feature a modern-day Vice City-like setting with improved gameplay mechanics and AI.
